organization_name: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins

measure: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
Proportion of Subjects Surviving at 1 Year
Investigator Assessment measured by 5-point improvement scale
Pulse rate (beats per minute) on admission
Respiratory rate (breaths per minute) on admission
Host-related factors associated with the pathogenesis of COVID-19
Virological factors associated with the pathogenesis of COVID-19
Number of Participants with Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
Change From Baseline in Symptom Severity
Device- and/or Procedure-related Serious Adverse Events
description: HbA1c is the glycosylated fraction of haemoglobin A. It is measured to identify average blood glucose concentration over prolonged periods of time. Least squares (LS) mean change from baseline was analysed by mixed model repeated measures (MMRM) model with treatment, country, Dipeptidyl peptidase IV (DPPIV) (yes/no), Sodium-glucose Cotransporter-2 (SGLT2) (yes/no), baseline body mass index (BMI) \[\<30, \>=30\]), visit, and treatment by visit interaction as fixed effects and the baseline HbA1c as a covariate.
The proportion of subjects surviving at 1 year was evaluated separately for each arm by the number of subjects alive at 1 year divided by the total number of subjects.
Degree of improvement in melasma or lentigines at 3 months post-final treatment measured by 5-point improvement scale.
Epidemiological data including demographic data, contact with COVD-19 positive patients and onset of symptoms.
Underlying chronic diseases, signs/symptoms related with COVID-19 diseases an clinical presentation on admission
Nasal and rectal swabs, fecal samples and blood samples

Renal denervation had been reported to cause a 30 mmHg fall in blood pressure when used in hypertension. Although in principle renal denervation might be favourable for physiology in chronic heart failure, numerous theoretical possibilities exist for the procedure causing deterioration in clinical status, including the possibility of a large fall in blood pressure.

A deterioration in symptomatic status or occurrence of an event such as presyncope or syncope would be considered a primary outcome event.
Comparison of wheal size (in mm) of skin reactions caused by a tester (duplicate skin pricking for each concentration of allergen administered)
Comparison of wheal size (in mm) of skin reactions caused by three different testers
Method of assessment - Visual analogue scale
Method of assessment - Visual analogue scale

Effectiveness will be assessed by the mean change in nasal symptoms using the 4-symptom rTNSS (reflective Total Nasal Symptom Score). The rTNSS is the sum of 4 individual patient-rated symptom scores for rhinorrhea, nasal congestion, nasal itching, and sneezing, each evaluated using a scale of 0=None
Method of assessment - Visual analogue scale
Safety will be evaluated based on the frequency of device- and/or procedure-related serious adverse events
Score on Functional Independence Measure (FIM) motor score, where 7 indicates total assistance/complete dependence and 91 is complete independence
